messageBody:
Marcy Spector wrote:

>Hi All-
>
> This is not directly related to JUnit, but there is a heated discussion internally here about what a 'unit' is - is it a method or a class?
>
> What's a better approach - isolate each method and test accordingly, or test at the class level?
>
> TIA.
>
>

Depends upon how you are approaching unit testing...

1) TDD - This is not unit testing - it merely uses unit tests to
describe the design.
Every line of code is only created if we have a failing test first
(Test, Code, Refactor)
Here the unit it the thing you want the design to do - typically for
me a unit is every method, but then I find lots of my classes only have
one method.


2) Unit testing - Where the tests come after the code - and is used to
verify the code works as (previous) designed - ...i.e. what most people
think of when we mention unit tests.
Typically I see most people start out testing the class but not
every method, nor every possible use/condition. They then start to test
those methods that they feel warrant more testing.

My 2c

HTH

Andrew
